greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of numbers <= n with same prime factors as n.
comment: For n > 1, a(n) gives the (one-based) index of the row where n is located in arrays A284311 and A285321 or respectively, index of the column where n is in A284457. A285329 gives the other index. - _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 17 2017
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
P. Erdős, T. Motzkin, Problem 5735, Amer. Math. Monthly, 78 (1971), 680-681. (Incorrect solution!)
H. N. Shapiro, Problem 5735, Amer. Math. Monthly, 97 (1990), 937.
formula: If A008683(n) <> 0 [when n is squarefree, A005117], a(n) = 1, otherwise a(n) = 1+a(A285328(n)). - _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 17 2017
maple: for n from 2 to N do
for k from 1 to nops(S) do V[S[k]]:= k od:
mathematica: PkTbl=Prepend[ Array[ Times @@ First[ Transpose[ FactorInteger[ # ] ] ]&, 100, 2 ], 1 ];1+Array[ Count[ Take[ PkTbl, #-1 ], PkTbl[ [ # ] ] ]&, Length[ PkTbl ] ]
Count[#, k_ /; k == Last@ #] & /@ Function[s, Take[s, #] & /@ Range@ Length@ s]@ Array[Map[First, FactorInteger@ #] &, 120] (* or *)
Table[Sum[(Floor[n^k/k] - Floor[(n^k - 1)/k]) (Floor[k^n/n] - Floor[(k^n - 1)/n]), {k, n}], {n, 120}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 20 2016 *)
program: (PARI) a(n)=my(f=factor(n)[,1], s); forvec(v=vector(#f, i, [1, logint(n, f[i])]), if(prod(i=1, #f, f[i]^v[i])<=n, s++)); s \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Oct 19 2017
results.author: _Jeffrey Shallit_, _Olivier Gérard_
